cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles ESE of the Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to cross the northern Leeward Islands Monday night and continue toward the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico Tuesday night–Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet; interests in the U.S. and British Virgin Islands advised to monitor
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet for Virgin Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely beginning late Tuesday with a high chance (54–85%) of sustained 34-kt winds and a 29–59% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force winds possible if Maria reaches major-hurricane strength near the port Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous storm surge of 3–5 ft possible along south- and east-facing shores of St. Croix if the center passes just south or over the island.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash floods and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and destructive waves, life-threatening surf and rip currents will build well ahead of the center.
